div.pre: 1976 Calabria, 1887 (185) Burial: c. 272 B.C. (Evans) Contents: 500+ AR Taras: 343+ st. (most Per. VII; a few Per. VIII) 68+ dr. (Athena/owl) Heracleia: 13+ st. (reduced weight) Thurium: 3+ st. (reduced weight) Disposition: Jameson 3 (Cat. 193, 249, 251); Vlasto 5 (Cat. 767, 798-9, 817, 1065) Evans, NC 1889, pp. 153-6, 216-7 Stazio, AIIN 1965-7, pp. 28-9 The contents of this hd. strongly suggest that it was buried within the territory of Taras, in which case the term Calabria (employed by Evans) must be understood in its ancient sense as referring to the heel of Italy
